content:
Add a Text Input Element to a FlexCard

Add a Text Input element on a FlexCard to enable users to enter one line of plain text. Configure properties and custom attributes, add an action, and add conditions.

From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Text element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:
In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
In Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
Check Required if the user must enter a value for this input element.
Check Read-only to disable modification of the input values.
Enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field in Help Text.

Click into Default Value to select a default input value or enter a plain text value.
In Mask, provide an input mask that formats data correctly.
Enter Minimum Length and Maximum Length for character requirements.
Configure additional properties by clicking + Add New in Custom Attributes.
Add Action to execute an action when interacting with the input element.
Add Conditions to add conditions for displaying the element.
Style the element using the Style panel.

FlexCards Text Input Element Properties
Text Input element properties are configurable in the Properties panel. Enable users to enter a single line of text.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Yes
No
title: Adding a Text Input Element to a FlexCard
